landing_platform.name: Wyndia Landing Platform
landing_platform.description: You step off the airship onto a wide, alabaster platform open to the sky. The wind whips around you, carrying the scent of clouds and a faint hum of magic. Gleaming white towers with jade-green roofs rise into the sky, connected by elegant, arching bridges. Winged Wyndian guards, clad in silver armor, stand at attention, their expressions stern and watchful.

central_plaza.name: The Grand Plaza of the Concord
central_plaza.description: The landing platform opens into a breathtaking circular plaza, the heart of Wyndia. In the center, a magnificent statue of a winged warrior, an ancestor of Nina, stands tall. The plaza is bustling with activity: nobles in fine silks converse in small groups, merchants hawk exotic goods from floating sky-barges, and acolytes from the Pinnacle of the Gale practice minor wind cantrips, their laughter carried on the breeze.

marble_way_bridge.name: The Marble Way Bridge
marble_way_bridge.description: A gracefully arched bridge of pure white marble, wide enough for a royal procession, ascends from the Grand Plaza towards the Noble Quarter. The bridge is lined with elegant, glowing crystals that serve as street lamps, and the view of the city's spires against the open sky is breathtaking. Nobles and their retinues can be seen strolling along its length, their conversations quiet and polite.

noble_quarter_gate.name: Noble Quarter Gate
noble_quarter_gate.description: The Marble Way Bridge ends at the formal gate to the Noble Quarter. The air here is noticeably calmer. Two stoic Royal Guards stand sentinel, their silver armor gleaming. They watch you with sharp eyes but do not bar your way.

royal_palace_grounds.name: Royal Palace Grounds
royal_palace_grounds.description: You are standing before the magnificent Royal Palace of Wyndia. The structure is a breathtaking fusion of architecture and nature, with living, sculpted trees forming its support pillars and flowering vines creeping up its white walls. Waterfalls cascade from its balconies into shimmering pools in the gardens below. This is the home of Lord Aerion and, presumably, Nina.

grand_foyer.name: Grand Foyer
grand_foyer.description: The interior of the palace is even more stunning than the outside. The foyer is a massive, open-air chamber with a soaring, vaulted ceiling of enchanted glass that shows the swirling clouds above. The floor is polished marble that seems to have silver mist flowing within it. Royal Guards stand like statues in every alcove. The acoustics are such that every whisper seems to carry.

throne_room.name: Throne Room
throne_room.description: Two immense, silver-inlaid doors open into the throne room. The chamber is long and formal, lined with banners depicting the history of Wyndia. At the far end, upon a raised dais, sits the elegant but austere Throne of the Winds, carved from a single piece of solidified cloud. This is where Lord Aerion holds court.

council_chamber.name: Council Chamber
council_chamber.description: This circular chamber is dominated by a large, round table made of petrified ironwood. Intricate maps of Eryndor and charts of trade routes are magically projected in the air above it. This is where the secret deals and political strategies of the Ember Concord are forged. The room is soundproofed by wind magic.

royal_apartments_hall.name: Hall of the Royal Apartments
royal_apartments_hall.description: This quiet, lushly carpeted hallway is a stark contrast to the public areas of the palace. The walls are lined with portraits of Wyndia's past rulers. The air is still and smells of night-blooming moonpetal flowers. Two ornate doors lead off from this hallway.

ninas_chambers.name: Nina's Chambers
ninas_chambers.description: Nina's room is a blend of royal elegance and practical training. A large, comfortable bed is neatly made, but across the room, a practice dummy is covered in scuff marks from sword practice. A bookshelf contains both treatises on Ember Concord law and well-worn adventure novels. A large, open-air balcony offers a stunning, private view of the clouds below, with a single, comfortable chair positioned to watch the sunset.

events.details: A successful Mind check might uncover Nina's personal journal, containing her private thoughts on her duties, her father, and perhaps, her feelings for Rya.

pinnacle_approach.name: Approach to the Pinnacle
pinnacle_approach.description: A long, ascending bridge leads to the single tallest spire in the city, the Pinnacle of the Gale. You can hear the faint, melodic chime of wind-powered contraptions and see young acolytes in flowing robes gliding on controlled updrafts between the academy's balconies. The entrance is a grand archway buzzing with magical energy.

bazaar_promenade.name: Bazaar Promenade
bazaar_promenade.description: A wide, bustling avenue that serves as the main artery to the market. The path is crowded with citizens and travelers from all over Eryndor. Street vendors sell roasted nuts and sweet sky-wine, and the sound of a dozen different languages fills the air. The architecture here is more functional, designed to handle heavy foot traffic.

merchant_bazaar.name: Merchant Bazaar
merchant_bazaar.description: You step into a bustling, open-air marketplace. The air is filled with the smells of exotic spices, the sounds of dozens of languages haggling over prices, and the sight of colorful banners fluttering from sky-barges moored to the platform. Merchants from all corners of Eryndor have stalls here, selling everything from Scalebound steel to enchanted Wyndian silks.

bazaar_finewares.name: Fine Wares Emporium
bazaar_finewares.description: This section of the bazaar caters to the city's elite. The shops here are elegant, with magically illuminated displays showcasing high-quality armor, masterwork weapons, and rare magical foci. The prices are exorbitant, but the quality is undeniable.

bazaar_artisans.name: Artisan's Corner
bazaar_artisans.description: The sound of hammers on anvils and the smell of hot metal fill this corner of the bazaar. Here, skilled craftsmen and women offer their services. You can find blacksmiths who can repair armor, alchemists selling potent salves, and enchanters willing to identify magical items for a fee.

bazaar_alley.name: Shady Alley
bazaar_alley.description: A narrow, crowded alley behind the main market stalls. The lighting is dim, and figures in hooded cloaks whisper in shadowed doorways. This is where one might go to find items that are not entirely legal, or to make contact with the Gilded Paw Caravan's information brokers.

events.details: A successful Spirit (Diplomacy) or Mind (Lore) check could lead to a meeting with a Gilded Paw agent.

commons_walkway.name: The Commons Walkway
commons_walkway.description: This path is quieter than the others, a wide walkway lined with sky-oaks and glowing flora. It is a more peaceful and communal area, with public seating and small fountains of purified water. Families and off-duty citizens use this space to relax and enjoy the view of the clouds below.

residential_spoke.name: Residential Spoke
residential_spoke.description: You enter a wide, peaceful promenade lined with elegant, multi-level homes. Unlike the grand palaces, these buildings are warmer and more inviting, with personal gardens on their balconies and wind chimes that create a constant, gentle melody. Winged citizens go about their daily lives; some carry groceries, others chat with neighbors, and children chase small, glowing motes of light that drift on the wind.

cloud_top_tavern.name: The Cloud-Top Tavern
cloud_top_tavern.description: A cozy, welcoming tavern with large, open-air windows that offer a stunning view of the clouds below. It's a popular gathering spot for off-duty guards, merchants, and local residents. The air is filled with the smell of roasted sky-fish and the sound of lively conversation and the occasional bard's tune.

events.details: A good place to gather common rumors about the city or find a lead for a side quest.

sky_garden_path.name: Sky-Garden Path
sky_garden_path.description: A quiet, winding path that weaves through a series of small, public gardens. Each garden is filled with unique, high-altitude flora that glows faintly in the city's ambient light. It's a peaceful, romantic spot, popular with couples and those seeking a moment of quiet reflection away from the bustle of the plaza.

aetherium_spires_access.name: Aetherium Spires Access
aetherium_spires_access.description: The path south from the plaza leads to a stark, functional gate of brass and iron. The air hums with immense power, and the scent of ozone is sharp. This is the entrance to the Aetherium Spires, the magical engine that keeps Wyndia afloat. Stern 'Spire Wardens' guard the entrance, barring entry to any without authorization.

spire_catwalks_main.name: Main Spire Catwalks
spire_catwalks_main.description: You are on a dizzying network of narrow, metal catwalks suspended between three of the colossal Aetherium Spires. Below you is a sheer drop to the clouds. The air crackles with raw magical energy arcing between the spires. The path splits into three distinct walkways, each leading to a different spire.

west_spire_conduit.name: West Spire Conduit
west_spire_conduit.description: This catwalk leads into the heart of the western spire, ending in a chamber filled with massive, humming arcane conduits that channel energy upwards. The heat is intense. A small, locked maintenance hatch is set into the far wall.

east_spire_maintenance.name: East Spire Maintenance
east_spire_maintenance.description: The eastern catwalk ends at a small maintenance platform. Spare parts, tools, and containers of viscous, glowing lubricant are stored here. It seems to be a dead end, but a careful observer might notice scuff marks near a specific wall panel.

events.details: A successful Mind check reveals a hidden access panel leading to a service duct.

aetherium_control_hub.name: Aetherium Control Hub
aetherium_control_hub.description: The central path leads to the primary control room for the entire spire network. A large, circular console of brass and crystal dominates the room, displaying the energy flow of the city. Standing before it, motionless as a statue, is a massive, gleaming construct of silver and gold, its single, crystalline eye glowing with a menacing red light. It is the Warden.

lower_service_duct.name: Lower Service Duct
lower_service_duct.description: A cramped, dark maintenance tunnel that runs beneath the main catwalks. The humming of the spires is muffled here, replaced by the sound of dripping condensation and the skittering of unseen things. This hidden path seems to bypass the main hub.

primary_gyroscope_chamber.name: Primary Gyroscope Chamber
primary_gyroscope_chamber.description: You emerge from the duct into the heart of Wyndia. In the center of this vast, spherical chamber is a colossal, multi-ringed gyroscope of brass and gold, spinning silently and flawlessly. It is this marvel of pre-Shattering engineering that grants the city its impossible stability. A single, locked control panel is situated on a raised dais.

events.details: The console is locked. A key or override code, likely held by the Warden in the Control Hub, is required to make any adjustments.
